DataElement.preferredDefinition: Indicator of whether or not Kaposi Sarcoma oral lesions are present on the lips.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Fleshy fold which surrounds the opening of the mouth._A malignant neoplasm characterized by a vascular proliferation which usually contains blunt endothelial cells. Erythrocyte extravasation and hemosiderin deposition are frequently present. The most frequent site of involvement is the skin; however it may also occur internally. It generally develops in people with compromised immune systems including those with acquired immune deficiency syndrome (AIDS)._Being or existing in a specified place or at the specified time.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Fleshy fold which surrounds the opening of the mouth.:A malignant neoplasm characterized by a vascular proliferation which usually contains blunt endothelial cells. Erythrocyte extravasation and hemosiderin deposition are frequently present. The most frequent site of involvement is the skin; however it may also occur internally. It generally develops in people with compromised immune systems including those with acquired immune deficiency syndrome (AIDS).

Concepts.definition: Fleshy fold which surrounds the opening of the mouth.

A malignant neoplasm characterized by a vascular proliferation which usually contains blunt endothelial cells. Erythrocyte extravasation and hemosiderin deposition are frequently present. The most frequent site of involvement is the skin; however it may also occur internally. It generally develops in people with compromised immune systems including those with acquired immune deficiency syndrome (AIDS).
